name: eps Eri
scenarioDescription:
The eps Eri Exoplanetary System

eps Eri is a star with 0.83 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.9199999999999999 times its radius. It is located 10.47 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 0.8 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

eps Eri is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.

eps Eri b

eps Eri b was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory using the radial velocity method. Its discovery was announced in 2000-12. Its semi-major axis is 3.39 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 2502.00 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, eps Eri.

Its eccentricity, the extent to which the shape of the exoplanet's orbit departs from a perfect circle (Earth's is 0.0167, which is why the shape of Earth's orbit is circular rather than oval in appearance), is 0.702, which means that when eps Eri b is at is at its closest point to its host star, 1.01 astronomical units separates the two, and when it is at its farthest point, this number is 5.77. In the case of Earth, these numbers are 0.9832899 and 1.0167103 respectively.

The mass of eps Eri b is 492.61 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, eps Eri b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system eps Eri, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Multiple Observatories.
